ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I feel apprehensive about using computers during therapy.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I am afraid that if I begin to use computers in therapy I will become dependent upon them and lose some of my own skills.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: The challenges of learning about computers in therapy seems overwhelming to me.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: If given the opportunity and training, I would like to use computers in therapy.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Using computers in therapy will interfere with rapport.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: My clients will be more likely to drop out of treatment if I use a computer program as part of therapy.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: My clients would find it engaging to learn new skills using a computer.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I believe that using computer programs in therapy will lead to better outcomes for my clients.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
